AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: No evidence of ATLAS/Hermes sending unhelpful or incorrect AI-generated responses to the customer. ATLAS entries are private workflow notes only, and all customer-facing updates appear to be from human agents.
evidence: “Kayako - ticket id 60234621 // ATLAS commented privately: Action: l1”
Customer-facing messages are signed by named agents (e.g., Priyanka Bhotika, Pavly Nashed, Chintan Parekh).

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: The customer was not stuck interacting with AI. Human agents responded publicly, and there is no repetition of AI prompts or customer complaints about AI.
evidence: Public responses from humans: “Dear Customer, We have received your escalation...” (Priyanka Bhotika)
“We have done a preliminary investigation...” (Pavly Nashed)

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: Support did not repeatedly ask for information already provided, and they acknowledged the escalation and moved to investigation/escalation. The customer asked for the ticket number, and support provided it.

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: Responses occurred within minutes to ~1 hour and the incident progressed the same day. No multi-day gaps or customer follow-ups about being ignored beyond the initial urgency statement.
evidence: Customer report at 2025-11-03T13:22:34+00:00; first public support acknowledgment at 2025-11-03T13:53:23+00:00
Ongoing updates and fix implemented the same day (fix comms at 15:50:44+00:00).

PREMATURE_CLOSURE.reasoning: Ticket communications indicate a fix was implemented and the related incident Jira was closed after remediation. There is no sign the customer had an unanswered pending question at the time of closure in this transcript.
evidence: “We have identified the cause of the chat widget outage and implemented a fix.”
Jira: “status is changed from In Progress to Closed” (CARESMM-9956)

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: Although this was a Severity 1 outage, support treated it as urgent: acknowledged escalation, performed preliminary investigation, escalated to infrastructure with highest priority, created an incident Jira, and implemented a fix within hours. No evidence of inappropriate low-urgency troubleshooting (e.g., blaming customer browser/network) in customer-facing responses.
evidence: Support: “We have received your escalation, and our team is currently reviewing the issue.”
Support: “We have done a preliminary investigation... escalated this to our infrastructure team with the highest priority.”
Incident created: “SaaS Jira - issue key CARESMM-9956 // Issue is created...”
